alert.note: Alert for Chambers; Coosa; Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 27 at 8:22AM CDT until March 27 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR CHAMBERS, SOUTHEASTERN COOSA AND CENTRAL TALLAPOOSA COUNTIES... At 822 AM CDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Alexander City, Valley, Lanett, Dadeville, Camp Hill, Lafayette, La Fayette, Jacksons` Gap, Lakeview, Cusseta, Ridge Grove, West Chambers, Trammel Crossroads, Sturkie, Buffalo, Chambers County Lake, Still Waters Resort, Denson, Eastern Lake Martin and Northern Lake Martin. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
